StringTable.Label: Tip_Format
StringTable.String: Tip: {DESCRIPTION}

StringTable.Label: Tip_YellowStar
StringTable.String: Yellow Stars are more likely to have habitable worlds in orbit.

StringTable.Label: Tip_PurpleStar
StringTable.String: Purple Stars are more likely to have Promethion in their systems.

StringTable.Label: Tip_RedStar
StringTable.String: Red Stars are more likely to have Durantium in their systems.

StringTable.Label: Tip_BlueStar
StringTable.String: Blue Stars are more likely to have Thulium in their systems.

StringTable.Label: Tip_MonsterNest
StringTable.String: Destroy space monster nests to keep them from overwhelming an area.

StringTable.Label: Tip_MinorWorld
StringTable.String: Minor Worlds in your zone of control give their outputs to the closest core world.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Approval
StringTable.String: Keep Approval high by addressing your citizen's needs… and lowering taxes, everybody likes low taxes.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Approval2
StringTable.String: Approval modifies Manufacturing and Research outputs. A population with 50% Approval loses half its Research and Manufacturing outputs.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Approval3
StringTable.String: A citizen's expectations influence their approval. Some beings require more pampering than others.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Rush
StringTable.String: Ships and Improvements can be rushed to build in one turn at a significant credits cost.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Anomalies
StringTable.String: There are many mysterious anomalies throughout the galaxy. Be sure to survey them with your flagship.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Asteroids
StringTable.String: Asteroid mining facilities are a valuable source of extra manufacturing.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Artifacts
StringTable.String: Powerful artifacts from the age of the Precursors are scattered throughout the galaxy. When found, you can store them in your vault for later use.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Capital
StringTable.String: Core world capitals provide adjacency bonuses to all districts and improvements.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Wonder
StringTable.String: Galactic Achievements are powerful improvements that can only be built once between all players. If you want one, make sure you're the first to complete it.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Terraforming
StringTable.String: Planet tiles can be added with the use of terraforming improvements, special events, and precursor artifacts.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Class
StringTable.String: Planet Class is a measurement of the useable tiles a planet has.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Gov
StringTable.String: Assign a governor to a class 10 or greater planet to turn it into a core world.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Gov2
StringTable.String: Be sure to keep your governor's loyalty high. If it dips too low, they may decide to split into their own civilization.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Gov3
StringTable.String: Leaders with high social skill, loyalty, and positive governance traits make good governors.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Minister
StringTable.String: Leaders can be assigned to minister positions to provide beneficial modifiers to your entire civilization.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Policies
StringTable.String: Enact policies that provide civilization-wide modifiers to better adapt your empire to the current situation.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Inputs
StringTable.String: Planetary inputs such as minerals, technology, and wealth are sent to the nearest core world to be transformed into their respective outputs: Manufacturing, Research, and Income.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Colony
StringTable.String: Class 9 and below planets make for good feeder colonies. Feeder colonies are planets that send their resources to larger, more productive Core Worlds.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Decay
StringTable.String: The further away a colony is from a Core World, the more of its resources will be lost in transit. The % lost is measured by Decay.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Influence
StringTable.String: Influence is radiated out from sources such as planets and starbases. The civ with the most influence on a hex will make that hex part of their zone of control.

StringTable.Label: Tip_CultureFlip
StringTable.String: A planet belonging to another civilization within your zone of control will begin to rebel. They may even culture flip and join your side.

StringTable.Label: Tip_CounterInfluence
StringTable.String: It's important to invest in your civilization's culture. Planets with low cultural investment will have low influence and may even fall into other civilizations' zone of control.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Diplo
StringTable.String: Improve diplomacy with other civilizations by assigning diplomats, trading, or making favorable event decisions.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Diplo2
StringTable.String: Better relations with a civilization will result in better trade deals, gifts, and possibly even alliances.

StringTable.Label: Tip_WarProfit
StringTable.String: Convince other civilizations to go to war via diplomacy. This is an especially good strategy for civilizations with the war profiteers ability, such as the Drath.

StringTable.Label: Tip_MiningStarbase
StringTable.String: Place mining starbases in a position that maximizes the amount of resources in their area of effect; they can mine multiple resources at once.

StringTable.Label: Tip_InfluenceStarbase
StringTable.String: Communications starbases can be used to help push your influence border or resist another Civilization's influence border.

StringTable.Label: Tip_EconomicStarbase
StringTable.String: Economic Starbases provide large bonuses to Manufacturing and Income to planets in their area of effect.

StringTable.Label: Tip_MilitaryStarbase
StringTable.String: Military starbases can be used to give your fleets significant advantages on the battlefield. Be wary of enemy fleets backed up by a enemy military starbase.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Fighter
StringTable.String: Fighters are critical in defending your fleet against enemy bomber swarms.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Fighter2
StringTable.String: Fighters can be useful in wearing down defenses of larger ships in attacking in swarms.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Bomber
StringTable.String: Bombers specialize in dealing devastating damage to capital ships.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Bomber2
StringTable.String: Bombers work best in swarms and ignore other smaller ships as long as there are capital ships to target.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Frigates
StringTable.String: Frigates are a larger and more sturdy option for dealing with fighter and bomber swarms.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Frigates2
StringTable.String: Frigates often work best mixed in with the faster-warming ship classes.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Cruiser
StringTable.String: Cruisers boast the increased firepower and defense options of capital ships at a cheaper and more flexible resource cost.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Battleship
StringTable.String: With a large hull, high hit points, and plenty of room for guns and defenses, Battleships make for a good backbone of fleets.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Dreadnought
StringTable.String: Dreadnoughts dominate space battles and will require many attackers to take down.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Kinetic
StringTable.String: Kinetic weapons are fast firing and decently accurate but they require close distances and are costly.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Beam
StringTable.String: Beam weapons are accurate and fire at an average rate. They are some of the most cost-effective weapons but don't excel at any one thing.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Missile
StringTable.String: Missile weapons have the longest range but can be inaccurate and slow to fire.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Armor
StringTable.String: On average, armor will mitigate the most damage when compared to other defensive systems. It is easily overcome by many attacks at once, however.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Shields
StringTable.String: Shields absorb damage and functionally work like extra health. They recharge in between battles but are overcome by large single attacks.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Evasion
StringTable.String: Evasion rolls on all incoming attacks and has a chance to dodge all damage. It can be hard to come by but is a very powerful defensive option for ships.

StringTable.Label: Tip_DefenseRepair
StringTable.String: Defenses (Armor, Shields, Evasion) repair to full strength in between battles.

StringTable.Label: Tip_RepairSpeed
StringTable.String: Ships have increased repair speed when in orbit of a friendly planet.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Volley
StringTable.String: Volleys are useful for softening up enemy fleets before engaging in battle.

StringTable.Label: Tip_SuperHighway
StringTable.String: Use military starbases with slipstream generator modules to create a super highway to quickly move fleets.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Invasion
StringTable.String: Core Worlds require ships with high conquest ratings to invade. Try Invader class ships or adding Transport Modules to your ships.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Invasion2
StringTable.String: Specializing Citizens as soldiers is a good way to increase your Planetary Defense.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Command
StringTable.String: Leaders can be assigned to unique and powerful command ships. Leaders with high Resolve and Diligence make for good commanders.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Culture
StringTable.String: Increase the discount for certain Culture Trait trees by making the appropriate event decisions.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Culture2
StringTable.String: The last culture trait in a tree unlocks a new powerful tech and often has powerful accompanying effects.

StringTable.Label: Tip_DataBank
StringTable.String: Looking for a planet to target with a devastating artifact power? Use the Data Bank to find out where it would hurt your enemy the most.

StringTable.Label: Tip_FastColony
StringTable.String: Need a faster colony ship? Add some more engines in the Ship Designer.

StringTable.Label: Tip_TelescopeTakeover
StringTable.String: Use the Telescope Takeover executive order to scout for habitable planets in the early game.

StringTable.Label: Tip_OrbitalAcademy
StringTable.String: The Orbital Academy can be upgraded to various more powerful orbital improvements.

StringTable.Label: Tip_ProbeRange
StringTable.String: Probes have unlimited exploration range from the start of the game.

StringTable.Label: Tip_ExtendRange
StringTable.String: Colonizable planet just outside of your ship's range? Build a starbase in that direction to extend the range.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Factions
StringTable.String: The Factions tab in the leader screen is a good place to "retire" obsolete leaders to.

StringTable.Label: Tip_TradeLicense
StringTable.String: Track trade routes and licenses on the trade tab in the civilization screen.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Bazaar
StringTable.String: Use the Galactic Bazaar to acquire those hard-to-get strategic resources… for a price, of course.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Galactapedia
StringTable.String: Use the Galactapedia (? next to the turn counter) to get more information and search for game terms.

StringTable.Label: Tip_LifeSupport
StringTable.String: Life support techs are valuable for extending ship range.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Hotkeys
StringTable.String: You can rebind useful hotkeys in the gameplay section of the options menu.

StringTable.Label: Tip_GridAndIcons
StringTable.String: You can adjust the zoom levels at which the grid and icons appear in the interface section of the options menu.

StringTable.Label: Tip_ShipRefit
StringTable.String: With the Starship Refits technolog, you can upgrade ships to be refitted with your latest defense systems and weapons.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Carriers
StringTable.String: Carriers keep a small fleet of fighters ready for battle. The fighters are automatically replaced if destroyed.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Criminals
StringTable.String: Handle criminals by imprisoning them or sending them to a distant colony.

StringTable.Label: Tip_Districts
StringTable.String: Building districts are essential to having productive planets. Click a tile you'd like to build on to see available districts.

StringTable.Label: Tip_PlayingWide
StringTable.String: Playing "wide" involves spreading out to as many colonies and core worlds as possible. Scouting and rushing colony ships early is important for this strategy.

StringTable.Label: Tip_PlayingTall
StringTable.String: Playing "tall" involves purposefully not spreading out and rather using your resources to build your few Core Worlds to be productive powerhouses.
